channel.title: RNZ New Zealand Headlines
channel.description: The Latest New Zealand headlines from RNZ News

item.title: Live: Covid-19 updates from New Zealand and around the world on 13 May
item.description: Urgent debate resumes in Parliament on Covid-19 legislation granting authorities sweeping powers under level 2. Watch the debate live here.

item.title: Employment of family members at council-owned firm raises questions
item.description: A union and a former Nelson mayor have raised questions over the employment of three members of one family at a council-owned firm.

item.title: Covid-19: Remote communities in Far North want checkpoints to remain in level 2
item.description: Checkpoints in Te Whānau a Apanui and on the East Coast will end today as the country prepares to move to level 2 - but two remote communities in the Far North want to keep their patrols going.

item.title: 'Huge increase' expected in people seeking benefits for first time
item.description: With unemployment expected to grow, beneficiary advocates say major changes to the welfare system are needed in Thursday's Budget.

item.title: Police trialled facial recognition tech without clearance
item.description: The police's high tech crime unit handling the technology appears to have not sought the necessary clearance before trialling it.

item.title: Housing groups call for dramatic investment to help in Covid-19 recovery
item.description: Housing groups are calling for a multi-billion dollar spend to echo the substantial build that followed the Great Depression.

item.title: Proposal to remove air traffic control services raises safety concerns - union
item.description: The president of the Air Line Pilots' Association says a proposal to remove air traffic control services from seven regional airports raises serious safety concerns.

item.title: Clarity on WINZ redundancy issue a couple of weeks away
item.description: MSD says it is moving with "urgency" to investigate after it appears Work and Income spent decades wrongly advising some benefit applicants that they cannot get support until their redundancy runs out.

item.title: Covid-19: Advocate reminds workers facing job loss 'no shame in standing up for what's right'
item.description: Staff threatened with dismissal and their employers need to be reminded their work rights have not been changed because of the Covid-19 crisis, says an employment law advocate.

item.title: Debut novelist wins top prize at Ockham NZ Book Awards
item.description: Two debut novelists have taken top prizes at this year's Ockham New Zealand Book Awards which were livestreamed.

item.title: New Plymouth heritage building renovations reveal signage and secrets
item.description: Renovations on a heritage building have set tongues wagging after they revealed signage dating back to when New Plymouth only had four-digit phone numbers.

item.title: Covid-19: Developments in New Zealand on 12 May
item.description: Today NZ reported no new daily cases for a third time in two weeks, strict rules around funerals and tangihanga riled people up, and the PM confirmed a September 19 election.

item.title: Body found in water at Evans Bay in Wellington
item.description: Police are asking the public to help identify a body found in the water at Evans Bay in Wellington today.

item.title: PPE guidelines leave businesses confused, out of pocket
item.description: Private businesses working in close contact with people must buy PPE themselves, ahead of alert level 2 - but some have too little and others too much.

item.title: Covid-19: Doctors' union wants answers over seven nurses infected at Waitākere Hospital
item.description: A doctors' union fears the Waitematā District Health Board is covering up mistakes that led to seven of its staff contracting Covid-19.

item.title: Schools prepare for level 2: Bullrush, assemblies, drinking fountains
item.description: Principals are pondering how to handle things as they prepare to reopen schools under alert level two on Monday.

item.title: DOC to reopen all facilities but Covid-19 rules still apply
item.description: Covid-19 alert level 2 means all Department of Conservation facilities, including huts and campsites, will reopen for public use.

item.title: City Rail Link on double-time to get up to speed
item.description: Work on Auckland's City Rail Link will move to 16 hours a day from Monday in a bid to make up for lost time and accelerate the long-delayed project.
